block.p: A memorial tribute to the theater producer Alexander H. Cohen will be held tomorrow at 11 a.m. at the Eugene O'Neill Theater, 230 West 49th Street, Manhattan. Among those who are to speak at the tribute, which is open to the public, are Frank Rich, an Op-Ed columnist and former chief theater critic for The New York Times, the director Harold Prince and the producer Gordon Davidson. Mr. Cohen died on April 22 at the age of 79.

A memorial tribute to the theater producer Alexander H. Cohen will be held tomorrow at 11 a.m. at the Eugene O'Neill Theater, 230 West 49th Street, Manhattan. Among those who are to speak at the tribute, which is open to the public, are Frank Rich, an Op-Ed columnist and former chief theater critic for The New York Times, the director Harold Prince and the producer Gordon Davidson. Mr. Cohen died on April 22 at the age of 79.
